text: Similar to influenza H5N1 virus, RSV is also a poor inducer of IFN-/ and is partially resistant to IFNs antiviral activity. When poly (ICLC), an IFN-inducer, was given before RSV infection, mice had a milder disease and / or faster recovery with increased IFN production and reduced viral replication [103] . However, when poly (ICLC) was administered 48 hours post-RSV infection, IFN-production was almost completely inhibited [103] .
